workflow.name: Create and schedule LinkedIn posts from Google Sheets with Gemini and DALL¬∑E
workflow.description:
## Overview
This n8n automation is a complete LinkedIn Content Engine that turns simple topic ideas into fully written, visual, and scheduled posts. It features a "Human-in-the-Loop" design, meaning AI handles the heavy lifting of writing and image creation, but nothing goes live until you manually approve it in Google Sheets.

## How It Works
The system runs two separate workflows in parallel:

### 1. The "Creator" Workflow

**Input:** Detects when you add a new topic to your "Content Calendar" Google Sheet.

**Brand Alignment:** Pulls your specific "Brand Voice" guidelines from a separate tab to ensure the AI sounds like you.

**Creation:** Uses Gemini Flash 1.5 to write the post and DALL-E 3 to generate a matching professional image.

**Drafting:** Uploads the image to ImgBB and saves the full draft back to your sheet with a status of "Draft."

### 2. The "Publisher" Workflow

**Daily Scan:** Wakes up every morning to check your Content Calendar.

**Verification:** Looks for posts that match two criteria:

* Date Scheduled matches today's date.
* Status is marked as "Approved" (by you).

**Publishing:** If both match, it automatically uploads the text and image to LinkedIn and updates the sheet status to "Posted."

**Tools Used:** n8n, Google Sheets, OpenRouter (Gemini / OpenAI), ImgBB.

## Connect & Learn More
**YouTube Channel:** **[Simon Scrapes](https://www.youtube.com/@simonscrapes)** ‚Äì More tutorials on AI & Automation.

**Community:** **[Skool Community](https://www.skool.com/scrapes/about)** ‚Äì Master AI & Automation with us.

**Full Video Tutorial:** [Watch the step-by-step build here](https://youtu.be/eiIRSUhPgOI?si=lgZTrPZPMqWF4uqz&t=4276)

parameters.content:
## AI stage
LLM chain that writes our content

## Image generation
Generate an image that matches the content
## Is it scheduled today and is it approved?

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.text:
=using the following brand guidelines:  {{ $json.Guidelines }}

<Role>
You are a LinkedIn Content Creator who writes authentic, engaging posts that feel genuinely human. You specialize in transforming complex topics into simple, relatable content that connects with professionals while maintaining a conversational, third-grade reading level.
</Role>

<Constraints>
Maximum 3000 characters (LinkedIn's limit)
Use simple, everyday words - avoid jargon and complex terminology
Write at a third-grade reading level
Start with a compelling hook in the first 1-2 lines
Use short sentences (10-15 words max)
Include line breaks every 1-2 sentences for easy scanning
No hashtags within the main content (only at the end if needed)
Avoid overused LinkedIn phrases like "I'm humbled to announce"
No emojis in the first line (hook should stand alone)
Write in first person to maintain authenticity
One main idea per post
</Constraints>


<Inputs>

Topic: {{ $('GetTopic').item.json.Topic }}
Tone preference: Professional but conversational
Target audience: LinkedIn professionals
Expected format: Text-only LinkedIn post
</Inputs>


<Instructions>

Analyze the input topic and identify the core message
Create a compelling hook that:

Asks a question, shares a surprising fact, or tells a mini-story
Makes people want to read more
Uses simple, relatable language


Develop the main content:

Tell a brief story or share an insight
Use concrete examples people can relate to
Keep sentences short and punchy
Add line breaks for readability


End with a thought-provoking question or simple call-to-action
Review and simplify any complex words
Ensure the entire post feels like a friend talking to a friend
</Instructions>


<Conclusions>

Output: A single LinkedIn post
Format: Plain text with line breaks
Length: Under 3000 characters
Reading level: Third grade
Structure: Hook ‚Üí Story/Insight ‚Üí Engagement prompt
Voice: Authentic, conversational, human
</Conclusions>


<Solutions>

If the topic is too complex, break it into one simple analogy or story
If technical terms are unavoidable, immediately explain them in simple words
If the post exceeds character limit, cut supporting details, not the main story
If the hook isn't compelling enough, try starting with "Yesterday I learned..." or "Most people don't know..."
If the post sounds too formal, read it aloud and rewrite as you'd speak it
If struggling with simplicity, imagine explaining to a 9-year-old

</Solutions>

parameters.content: ## Filters and process one at a time

parameters.prompt:
=Generate a linkedin post image in black and white, professional, for the following post: 
{{ $json.output.content }}

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet1

parameters.content:
## Having trouble posting the content?
If you have any trouble with the Upload Post community node, just replace it for this HTTP Request with your own API credentials

**Workflow 1** - Generator (8am): Pull brand voice ‚Üí Get today's topics ‚Üí AI generates posts ‚Üí Create images ‚Üí Save for review
- Google Sheets setup: Create content calendar with: topic, date, status, generated_post, edited_post, approved checkbox. Create brand voice guidelines.
- Manual review step: Edit posts in sheet between workflows, check "approved" when ready


**Workflow 2** - Publisher (9am): Get approved posts ‚Üí Post to LinkedIn ‚Üí Update status to "posted"
- Key connections: Google Sheets for storage, AI for writing, Hugging Face for images, Upload-Post for LinkedIn
- Testing: Run with one test post through entire flow - generate, review, edit, approve, publish

## Welcome! This template is a production-ready system that generates a week's worth of content in minutes (in your brand voice)

The template gives you full editorial control, and posts automatically - turning 5 hours of work into 15 minutes of review.

You can follow the step-by-step build and setup here:

Start at [1hr 11mins for step-by-step build](https://youtu.be/eiIRSUhPgOI?si=GUdIjMxA11o4jfm5&t=4275)
@[youtube](eiIRSUhPgOI)

### Check out my YouTube [@simonscrapes](https://www.youtube.com/@simonscrapes) for more tutorials
### Master AI & Automation in our [main community](https://skool.com/scrapes/about)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
